content: The world's largest tropical rainforest is located in which South American country?

The world's largest tropical rainforest is located in Brazil, in South America. It is called the Amazon Rainforest, and it covers a vast area of the country, as well as parts of neighboring countries like Peru and Colombia. The Amazon Rainforest is often referred to as the "lungs of the Earth" because it produces a significant amount of the world's oxygen and is home to a wide variety of plant and animal species.
